sect2.title: The official NetBSD Foundation Logo
sect2.para: The NetBSD Flag image is the official logo of The NetBSD Foundation. For copyright information and credits, please see the disclaimer page.

sect2.title: The previous official NetBSD Logo
sect2.para: The old logo of The NetBSD Foundation was created by Shawn Mueller in 1994, it was replaced by the new "flag" image created by Grant Bisset in 2004. See the disclaimer page for more information.

sect2.title: How to download the images
sect2.para: The first step in the process is to download one of the above images. Some of the more common options are:

itemizedlist.listitem:
Graphical browsers - www/navigator / www/mozilla / www/Mosaic / www/grail / chimera
In Navigator, Mozilla and Grail, right-click (or left-click depending on your orientation) on the image to bring up the pop-up menu. Click the "Save Image As..." option to download it ("Save Image image name..." in Grail).
In Mosaic, also bring up the pop-up menu that same way. Then you'll have to move the mouse over the "Image" option and click "Save" on the sub-menu to download it.
And finally, to download the logos in Chimera, either middle click on the image you want, or click on it and save it in the external program you have set up.

Text Browsers - www/lynx / www/links / www/w3m
In Lynx or Links, type "d" when you have the alt text of the image you want highlighted.
In w3m, type "ESC I" when the cursor is over the alt text of the image you want.
